description:
A visionary strategist, entrepreneur and innovative change agent focused on delivering customer-centric solutions, Maureen Thomas is known for accelerating strategic partnerships across sectors in an organic inclusive process that builds on the diverse talents and strengths of the partnering organizations, team members and stakeholders. 
Ms. Thomas served in the Naval Reserves as a liaison officer, duty briefer and public affairs officer. After earning a masters degree in management and public policy from the University of Maryland School of Public Policy, she gained experience working in the federal space before moving into industry, nonprofit management, and ultimately founding her own startup. Ms. Thomas brings unique talents as a tech translator, connector, motivator and accelerator of innovative change. Specialties include branding, scaling outreach and operations, diversifying revenue streams, and building strategic public/private partnerships for organizations focused on growing a sustainable and innovative culture. Experience includes serving as team lead for strategic planning and change management in growth-oriented and startup environments requiring a multi-disciplinary approach to developing and initiating new opportunities for small businesses while working with a diverse mix of stakeholders. Ms. Thomas has established a reputation as an energetic, creative and collaborative problem-solver with a demonstrated passion for growing mission-oriented organizations and advocating for small businesses, including working with veteran-owned and women-owned small businesses.

Ms. Thomas serves frequently as speaker/panelist and organizes virtual and hybrid conferences and technical symposiums on entrepreneurship, women in innovation, small business opportunities/startup funding vehicles, technology and SBIR/STTR. She has published articles on small business challenges in tech industries, including satellite, microelectronics, cyber and UAS/UAV. In her free time she can be found working on her restored sailboat or cycling the C&O canal.

description:
I work with female executives to eradicate the stigma of shame of having their name in an employment lawsuit.  Join our mastermind group to help you reach your goals. 

It is beyond ‚Äúuncomfortable‚Äù to have your name in an employment lawsuit. 

It is even more uncomfortable to find your name on the list as a subject or an individual defendant.  

I know, because it happened to me.

I am tired of being ashamed for what was 12 years between when I was contacted as a ‚Äúwitness‚Äù to an investigation to when I was vindicated on all charges by the Merit Systems Protection Board.   

Ashamed is feeling that we cannot speak of the unspeakable. To talk of the experience is to expunge that shame.  This is a selfish part of this action. The magnanimous part of talking about the experience is that I know this is something many federal executives are dealing with.  

As federal leaders, we do not have the freedom to discuss our case and are prohibited from disclosure of it ‚Äì which is completely understandable. We are permitted to talk about it is impacting us. The issues of the experience are under discussed.  

My goal is to put it out there and stop pretending that it‚Äôs not happening in the workplace; that it isn‚Äôt impacting us professionally, personally, physically, mentally, spiritually, and financially.  
The issues of leading while being named in a lawsuit or investigation are mental, physical, real, and impactful.  

Our mastermind group are federal executives who operate at a similar level, share similar values, and are looking to join a supportive community. Most importantly, all members have been named in an investigation or lawsuit and are seeking to grow and develop themselves personally and professionally.

Our members help each other reach their goals.  We engage in brainstorming, problem-solving, decision making, and sharing of ideas, solutions, and resources. A large part of each meeting is devoted to individual Hot Seats, where each member can share a challenge or question, and everyone helps the person in the Hot Seat by asking questions, listening, and providing knowledge, wisdom, and experiences. 

If you have been, or currently are a federal senior executive and named as a subject or defendant in an investigation or lawsuit ‚Äì let‚Äôs talk.

Let‚Äôs start with a 5-minute phone call. Contact me at any time at KC@CoffmanCoaching.com. 

I look forward to you joining our Mastermind group soon.

Best to you,
KC
Katherine Coffman
Coffman Coaching, LLC
